body.p:
La Grange Ky
Octr 5th 1863
His Excellency
Gov: Bramlett
Honrd Sir:

You will find accompanied with this a petition to Your Honor for the remission of a fine imposed on me by a Court and Jurey in Louisville. The circumstance of the case are set forth in the pettition. I could get other good & loyal men to sign the petition but I deem it unnecessary. I am now living in La Grange Ky. If you desire others, I can get the leading Union men of the town to sign it.
I hope this will meet with your approval for I am poorly able with my large family to support, to pay so large a fine, having been broken up by losses sustained by aggressions committed by the rebels
P. S. I know Mr Williams well, and know him to be a peaceble & loyal citizen who was runaway from his home in Garrard County only for his loyalty & desire to submit to the laws of his country.

Respectfully
W. C. Mahan, Clk of the Oldham Cir. Ct.
